activities: Jetstream PLM, Inc. ("JETSTREAM PLM") receives personal information from the EU (both online and offline) in connection with its and its affiliates business activities, including personal information from or concerning prospective, current and former: customers; partners and resellers; and suppliers and vendors for processing and storage. JETSTREAM PLM uses this personal information in connection with its product and services offerings primarily for: (i) customer service activities; such as processing orders and improving offerings; (ii) sales and marketing activities; (iii) enabling and providing services, including technical support, consulting and training; (iv) business management; (v) fraud detection and prevention and to protect its rights, property, or safety; and (vi) compliance with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies. JETSTREAM PLM also receives personal information from the EU (both online and offline) concerning prospective, current and former: employees; consultants; contractors; and job applicants for processing and storage. JETSTREAM PLM uses this personal information for purposes of workforce management primarily for: (i) evaluation for employment or engagement; (ii) providing employment benefits; (iii) administration of compensation and equity programs; (iv) performance management and training; (v) budgeting; (v) delivery of our services to our customers; (vii) ensuring workplace safety; (viii) providing company network access/authentication; (ix) and legal and policy compliance and reporting
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human resources, customer, prospect, partner and supplier data (both online and offline)
recoursemech: Jetstream PLM, Inc. has committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints under the Safe Harbor Principles that do not concern organization human resources data to the International Centre for Dispute Resolution (ICDR), operated by the American Arbitration Association (AAA). International Centre for Dispute Resolution 1633 Broadway, 10th Floor, New York, NY 10019; Telephone: 01 212-484-4181; Fax 01 212-246-7274; or http://www.adr.org/ICDR
